item.title: NOLA Notary Opens New Office
item.description: NOLA Notary Public Opens New Office Location Today, August 28, 2019, NOLA Notary Public opened its new office location at 8200 Hampson St., Ste. 229 in River Bend, New Orleans. Uptown New Orleans Notary We are excited to be located in the heart of New Orleans. Our new office is conveniently located Uptown, across the street from a variety of local restaurants and other businesses. Come visit our new office today!

item.title: Attorney v Non Attorney Notaries
item.description: Attorney vs. Non-Attorney Notaries: What's the Difference? Generally speaking, the difference between what a non-attorney notary and a notary with an active law license ultimately boils down to the minutiae of when, where, and how each is allowed to exercise their authority. Are All Notaries Required to Have a Law License? Due to the significant role a notary has in the legal process, many assume that being a licensed attorney is mandatory to qualify for the accreditation necessary to perform notarial functions and exercise this authority.

item.title: What is A Notary's Jurisdiction?
item.description: What Determines a Notary‚Äôs Jurisdiction of Power? After becoming an appointed notary in Louisiana, all notaries have the authority to make oaths; give oaths; swear someone in prior to their given testimony during a deposition while reporters are present; as well as confirm and authenticate information, such as interrogatories or other pleadings, in courts of record for Louisiana, as described in La. Rev. Stat. Ann. ¬ß 35:3 and La. Rev. Stat.

item.title: How to Become a Louisiana Notary?
item.description: How to become a Louisiana Notary? Louisiana law, particularly RS 35:191 A.(1), states that any person may be appointed as a notary public in and for the parish in which he resides and in and for any one other parish in which he maintains an office. Here, the main requirement is residency. Note: the plain language of RS 35:191 requires that a person seeking to be appointed as a notary public in a parish must be a resident of that parish or maintain an office in the parish.

item.title: What is a Notary?
item.description: What is a Notary? Notary Public Definition Louisiana law does not directly define the term ‚Äúnotary public.‚Äù Nevertheless, the Louisiana State Legislature is tasked with creating and controlling the office of notary public in Louisiana. So . . . What is a notary? Merriam-Webster's dictionary defines a notary as: ‚Äúa public officer who attests or certifies writings (such as a deed) to make them authentic and takes affidavits, depositions, and protests of negotiable paper.
